title: Superstars Cavendish, Renshaw join Ryder’s African stars | Other Sport
text:
STEP UP: Mark Cavendish and Mark Renshaw will cycle for the SA-based Team Dimension Data next year. The pair were pictured in Cape Town earlier this year where they rode the Cape Town Cycle Tour. Picture: GALLO IMAGES Related articles World Tour next stop for Ryder’s cycling stars MTN-Qhubeka to become Team Dimension Data SA team rider claims cycling stage victory in Spain SA’s MTN-Qhubeka cycling team announced on Tuesday the signing of sprinters Mark Cavendish and Mark Renshaw for next season.
Qhubeka, who will shortly undergo a name change to Team Dimension Data, have also added Austrian Bernhard Eisel, who will be released by Team Sky at the end of the season.
"I’m superexcited about becoming a part of the team for 2016. It is a team that I have watched closely as it has grown, especially over this season and been impressed with the spirit, strength and dynamics of the group," said Cavendish, a winner of 26 Tour de France stages and former road race world champion. "It’s fair to say that most of the peloton has seen how incredible the team raced this year."
Cavendish will leave Belgian team Etixx-Quick Step, at which he has spent the last three years but for whom he will not race again as his season is over due to shoulder surgery last week.
In July, Qhubeka became the first African team to race in the Tour de France.
Cavendish was once regarded as the fastest sprinter in the world but has seen Germans Marcel Kittel and Andre Greipel eclipse him in recent years.
"Mark Cavendish joining our team is a huge step forward for the team as we strive to get to the next level in world cycling," Qhubeka team principal Douglas Ryder said. "To also integrate Mark Renshaw and Bernie Eisel is a game changer in terms of performance and experience, which, added to the incredible talent we already have in the team opens up possibilities."
Australian Renshaw has been Cavendish’s chief lead-out rider for several years, dating back to their time at HTC Highroad together in 2009-2011.
Although they went their separate ways when Cavendish joined Sky in 2012, Renshaw was recruited by Etixx-Quick Step last year to reunite the pair.
During July’s Tour, Cavendish spoke of his desire to stay with Etixx — albeit on a reduced salary — but the Belgian outfit are believed to have been less keen to continue the partnership.
AFP
